basic_information.scholarship_name: The Marissa Murrow Legacy Scholarship for Teacher Education
basic_information.scholarship_notes: Eligible for full disbursement if graduating in December

description: Scholarship Mission: To provide scholarship assistance to Juniors or Seniors within the College of Education & Professional Studies who are pursuing a career in teaching. This scholarship was established to honor the legacy of former UCO student and special education major, Marissa Murrow. Eligibility Requirements Complete application and provide official transcript Must be admitted to the Teacher Education program at UCO Preference will be given to a Special Education student major Must be a Junior or Senior level at time scholarship funds are distributed Must be involved with at least one on campus or community organization Complete a short essay describing which organization you are involved with at UCO, what you have learned from this organization and how you plan to impact your community Preference may be given to student(s) demonstrating academic excellence Selection Process Recipients of the scholarship will be selected by a departmental committee Award Requirements Must be enrolled in the upcoming fall and spring semester to receive award Attendance at an awards banquet is required for all recipients Recipients must write a thank you letter to the donors of the scholarship
